episode_event_salon_pasiosalon_date_ch01:
[Name:PlayerNickname ] noticed that
recently, Lusamine had been coming over to
chat a lot more than usual.

Oh, [Name:PlayerNickname ]! How
are you? Same as last time I saw you?

Has anything been bothering you?
If there’s anything at all I can help you with,
you know you can tell me anytime!
Oh... Everything’s fine? Well... That’s great.
(Ask her if something’s wrong.)
Actually...yes. I suppose I’ll tell you.

(Tell her you’re sorry there wasn’t
anything to help with.)

No, no need to apologize! Actually, it’s me
who’s been...dealing with some things lately.
The truth is, ever since I came to Pasio...
I’ve felt less and less needed as a parent.

Both Lillie and Gladion have grown up to be
so strong and brave...

So I thought the best thing I could do was
watch them grow.

But as they become more independent, I feel
lonely...as if there’s a hole in my heart.
And I think because of that...

I tried filling that void by getting close to you
and watching over you instead, since you’re
so close in age to Lillie and Gladion.
But that’s no good, is it.

Anyway, thank you for listening to me go
on like that. It helped me get my feelings
straight.

Sorry for being selfish and wrapping you up
in my drama. Well, I’ll see you later.
A few days later...

[Name:PlayerNickname ] heard from
Aether Foundation employees that the
president wasn’t doing well.
So [EN:Gen Ref="255" M="he" F="she" ] went to go see Lusamine...

Now I’ve even got my subordinates worried
about me. Not very becoming of a president,
is it?

The cause of all this is... Well, it’s what we
talked about the other day.

One of the reasons I worked hard at my job
was to protect my children.

I was the only parent they had to
depend on.

But both Lillie and Gladion have become so
strong, they can go on their own adventures
now.

So...why am I still working so hard?
I don’t know. And now I’m doing everything
half-hearted.

[Name:PlayerNickname ]... What exactly
is a parent, anyway?

(Tell her kids want a parent to be
someone they can look up to.)
Someone to look up to...

(Tell her a parent will always be a
parent, no matter what.)
Always, no matter what...

I suppose you’re right. When you put it like
that, it seems so obvious.

As both a parent and a person who has to
choose her path in life...

I have a responsibility to lead by example
and show them how to live strong.
No matter how grown they get.
Thank you, [Name:PlayerNickname ].

I realized some important things talking
to you.

Maybe my role as my children’s protector
is over.

But that just means I need to move on to the
next stage as a parent.
OK... I can do this.

After all, it’s me, Lusamine, we’re talking
about.
